description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**Freshman English**

**Fall 2018**

**Objectives**: This course aims to train students’ skills for active, fluent reading and cultivate their comprehensive knowledge and critical thinking in various subjects (biology, business, social psychology, architecture, etc.) through lectures, exercises, discussions and online self-study activities.

**Grading Policy**: Students’ term grades will be given based on their performances on the following aspects: attendance, participation, class work (quizzes, discussions, assignments, and presentations) 50%; self-access 10%; midterm 20%; final exam 20%.

**Textbook:** Julia Williams and David Hill (2010). _Academic Connections 3._ New York: Longman.

**Online Resource:** www.MyAcademmicConnectionsLab.com

**Schedule**

Week 1: Orientation

Week 2:

     Unit 1 Biology: Brains and Gender

     Previewing (pp.2-4); Building Academic Reading Skills (pp.4-8)

     Readings: “One Human Brain, or Two?”/“Brain Scan Images”

Week 3:

     Unit 1 Biology: Brains and Gender

     Building Academic Reading Skills (pp.9-12); Building Academic Listening Skills (pp.13-15/Lecture:      “Different Genders, Different Medicines?”)

Week 4:

     Unit 1 Biology: Brains and Gender

     Building Academic Listening Skills (pp.16-17); Building Academic Writing Skills (pp.18-22)

Week 5:

     Unit 2 Business: Pricing

     Previewing (pp.24-27); Building Academic Listening Skills (pp.27-34/Lecture: “Pricing”)

Week 6:

     Unit 2 Business: Pricing

     Building Academic Reading Skills (pp.34-43)

     Reading: “Pricing Considerations”

Week 7:

     Unit 2 Business: Pricing

     Building Academic Speaking Skills (pp.43-48)

Week 8: Catch up!

Week 9: Midterm Exam

Week 10: Film-viewing

Week 11:

     Unit 3 Social Psychology: Conformity

     Previewing (pp.50-52); Building Academic Reading Skills (pp.52-60)

     Readings: “The Asch Effect”/“Business Decision Making”

Week 12:

     Unit 3 Social Psychology: Conformity

     Building Academic Listening Skills (pp.61-67/Lecture: “Groupthink”)

Week 13:

     Unit 3 Social Psychology: Conformity

     Building Academic Writing Skills (pp.68-72)

Week 14:

     Unit 4 Architecture: Aesthetics

     Previewing (pp.74-76); Building Academic Listening Skills (pp.77-86/Lecture: “Architecture for the       People: Emotional Responses)

Week 15:

     Unit 4 Architecture: Aesthetics

     Building Academic Reading Skills (pp.86-93)

     Readings: “What Makes a Building Attractive? Some Ideas Through the Ages”/“Money Is the     

     Overriding Problem with Architecture Today”

Week 16:

     Unit 4 Architecture: Aesthetics

     Building Academic Speaking Skills (pp.93-98)

Week 17: Catch up!

Week 18: Final Exam

**Guidelines and requirements**:

1.      Punctual attendance is required.

2.      Actively participate in class discussions.

3.      Visit the online course board on a regular basis.

4.      Use Self-Access Room, Writing Clinic ([http://140.122.83.189/moodle/](`http://140.122.83.189/moodle/`)), and English Chat Room as much as you can. You are expected to visit the Self-access Classroom for **_10 hours_** this semester.
